image.altText: Douglas Boyd conducting the Adelaide Symphony Orchestra in concert at the Adelaide Town Hall.

props.synopsis: Adelaide's culture of music has garnered global recognition, but some arts leaders say there's a missing piece of the puzzle.

title.children: 'A sore point': Adelaide's long wait for a purpose-built concert hall

image.altText: Two people in orange uniforms walk along a 1.5-metre high wall covered with tarp and along the bottom sand bags.

props.synopsis: With a floodwater levee wrapped around their town, residents in the remote South Australian community of Innamincka say they are stocked up and ready for weeks in isolation.

title.children: Locals prepared as floodwaters isolate remote SA township

image.altText: Wedges of blue cheese piled on a metal counter.

props.synopsis: Dairy farmers say the sector is struggling amid consumers turning to cheaper cheese imports flooding supermarket shelves.

title.children: Australians choosing cheaper imported cheese in cost-of-living crisis

image.altText: Ken Hinkley walking on Adelaide Oval after a Power win.

props.synopsis: Exactly seven months on from a nail-biting semifinal that ended on a sour note, Port Adelaide and Hawthorn headline Sunday's Gather Round action. Follow live.

title.children: Port and Hawthorn meet for first time since bitter ending to semifinal

image.altText: A woman wearing a red blazer is talking with shadows in front of her

props.synopsis: Until the last election, the electorate of Boothby hadn't been in the hands of a Labor candidate since 1949 — but the ALP's Louise Miller-Frost broke that streak by winning the seat, and is now taking another tilt.

title.children: Labor won Boothby for the first time in 73 years — can it hold it?

image.altText: Dark grapes on a vine.

props.synopsis: The CSIRO and Wine Australia are trialling fast-growing, mildew-resistant grapevines designed to maintain yield and wine quality in a changing climate.

title.children: Tiny vines could hold the key to a future-proof wine industry

image.altText: An aerial shot of sandy desert meeting an inland lake with blue skies.

props.synopsis: The deluge which battered south-west Queensland is now draining downhill to a catchment area five times the size of the UK.

title.children: Floodwaters to create Australia's largest lake in 15 years

image.altText: House fire crime scene at Woodville Gardens, SA

props.synopsis: South Australian police have arrested two men and charged them with the murder of a Woodville Gardens man who was found dead after a house fire in November 2024.

title.children: Murder and arson charges laid after Adelaide house fire

image.altText: Reuben Ginbey and Zac Williams roll upside down as they are tangled in a tackle

props.synopsis: As Brisbane and the Western Bulldogs played one of the games of the year in Norwood, Adelaide Oval was treated to a double header of gloriously bad football. This was Gather Round's first ever Sicko Saturday.

title.children: Gather Round's Sicko Saturday treats Adelaide Oval to some gloriously bad football

image.altText: Composite image of three people, a woman smiling, a man with blond hair and a woman talking into a microphone

props.synopsis: Politicians are on a mission this election to connect with voters online like never before. It is opening the door for podcasters and social media personalities to have increasing political influence.

title.children: 'Delulu with no solulu': Influencers changing how politicians campaign

image.altText: Pacific oyster

props.synopsis: A review into the deaths of 70 per cent of South Australia's oyster spat has not unearthed any clues.

title.children: Cause of oyster spat deaths at research facility remains a mystery

image.altText: A blonde man in a tux speaks in front of a US flag

props.synopsis: In last week's market chaos, traders turned their backs on US government bonds. Is Donald Trump destroying America's "exorbitant privilege"?

title.children: As Trump destroys America’s 'exorbitant privilege', the dollar will decline

image.altText: Wide shot of Newcastle Beach with breaking waves rolling onto the beach with the headland in the distance

props.synopsis: Police received reports early on Sunday morning that a woman had entered the water at Newcastle Beach and failed to return.

title.children: Search underway for missing swimmer off Newcastle

image.altText: A teenage boy drawing on a paper and drinking juice

props.synopsis: An autistic and non-verbal teenage boy who was shot repeatedly by Idaho police has died after being removed from life support, his family says.

title.children: Teen with autism shot by Idaho police has died, his family confirms

image.altText: happy snowboarders

props.synopsis: International tourists, especially Australians, started to arrive en masse in the famous Japanese ski resort of Niseko in the early 2000s. Now the influx has pushed the cost of housing so high it's almost impossible for locals to compete with wealthy foreigners for property.

title.children: Foreign ski bums turned this Japanese mountain into a real estate nightmare

image.altText: Charles and Camilla grin and embrace

props.synopsis: It's been 20 years since Charles was finally able to marry the love of his life, but his wedding to Camilla featured a bout of sinusitis, an unhappy son, and a requirement that they both apologise to God for their behaviour.

title.children: 'Taken to the town square and humiliated': Charles and Camilla's awkward wedding

image.altText: Peter Dutton at cafe with local candidate Tom White in Perth Electorate of Swan__cccefbd2b999c91e0d34614406b2dcef

props.synopsis: The full offset would be available to those who earn between $48,000 and $104,000.

title.children: Dutton pledges one-off $1,200 tax offset to half of taxpayers

image.altText: Parker Posey, wearing a printed kaftan and stylish sunglasses, at a leafy Thai resort on the set of The White Lotus

props.synopsis: Our fascination with the rich and famous often seems to curdle into something darker, even if it is hard to tell if we're eating the rich or eating cake.

title.children: Is our obsession with The White Lotus a sign we've had enough of the 1 per cent?

image.altText: A stonefish being held above a tank

props.synopsis: Squeezed from the skin of a stonefish, a recently discovered toxin shows enormous promise, according to researchers in Far North Queensland.

title.children: Stonefish toxin could be new weapon against one of livestock's biggest threats

image.altText: A destroyed neighbhourhood

props.synopsis: Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz says military operations will intensify and expand to other areas throughout most of Gaza while Gazans are urged to evacuate from the battlefield.

title.children: Israel cuts off Gaza's southern city of Rafah, seizing key corridor

image.altText: Four people stand with a white guardian dog in front of them, surrounded by chickens, in front of a chicken "tractor".

props.synopsis: The Andrews family wants to revolutionise Australian farming by proving you can run a profitable farm and regenerate the natural environment.

title.children: Family proves profitable farming and healthy ecosystems can go hand in hand

image.altText: Flags of Iran and US merged.

props.synopsis: With Donald Trump and Benjamin Netanyahu threatening to bomb Iran if it does not restrain its nuclear ambition, the discussions in Oman come at a crucial time.

title.children: US and Iran hold 'positive and productive' talks over Tehran nuclear program

image.altText: Jason Day celebrates after chipping in for birdie as fans rejoice

props.synopsis: Australian Jason Day will enter the final round of the US Masters with an outside chance of victory, as Rory McIlroy storms to the lead.

title.children: Day chip-in birdie keeps hope alive, McIlroy and DeChambeau set for showdown

image.altText: Stephen wears a black shirt and holds a tray of white and brown butterflies next to cabinets.

props.synopsis: In Stephen Brown's collection of about 20,000 butterflies are three new species he discovered while searching the country's most remote places.

title.children: Butterfly collector's quest to discover what needs protecting

image.altText: A very toothy fish mouth.

props.synopsis: Four kilometres below the Southern Ocean surface is a strange world inhabited by even stranger creatures. In its autumn voyage, the CSIRO's Research Vessel Investigator took a closer look.

title.children: Deep sea photos reveal the otherworldly creatures of Bass Canyon

image.altText: Dried footprint pressed into damp claypan

props.synopsis: Scott Avery has dedicated his life to fighting for the rights of First Nations Australians and people with disability. His mission is inspired by ancient footprints thought to have belonged to a one-legged man on a hunt with his community.

title.children: What the story of an ancient one-legged man can teach us about inclusion

image.altText: A teenage girl, smiling, holds a Lego robot.

props.synopsis: High school student Frida Aaso is part of Australia's top Lego robotics team that has won through to the US final of an international competition.

title.children: Teen robotics wizards ready to take on world's best in Texas

image.altText: A rectangular cream house with a blue roof on a green hillside at sunset with trampoline, clothesline and trees surrounding.

props.synopsis: In a bid to support self-built low-cost housing, an architect who built his own property for $150,000, has released free plans for others to download and use.

title.children: Architect uploads free plan for owner-builders to use

image.altText: Zoe embraces her mum, Alex Neville, alongside twin sister Kate

props.synopsis: A new report has found gynaecological cancers have been among the poorest funded for almost two decades — these women hope to change that.

title.children: 'A ticking time bomb': Dying women join campaign for cancer research

image.altText: A pair of hands are seen demonstrating how to brush dentures with a toothbrush.

props.synopsis: Imagine living in aged care and not having your teeth or dentures properly cleaned and checked each day. That's a risk faced by elderly Australians, prompting calls for the next federal government to boost oral health training and services.

title.children: Push for seniors' dental scheme grows ahead of federal election

image.altText: A woman sits in front of her laptop with her smartphone, using a two factor authentication app

props.synopsis: The exemptions announced by the US Customs and Border Protection office cover various electronic goods including smartphones and components entering the United States from China.

title.children: US exempts smartphones and computers from Trump's reciprocal tariffs

image.altText: Torrie Lewis, Bree Rizzo and Leah O'Brien hit the line together the women's 100m final at the national championships.

props.synopsis: The barest of margins separate Paris Olympian Torrie Lewis and boom 17-year-old Leah O'Brien in the women's 100 metres final at the Australian Athletics Championships.

title.children: Lewis wins national 100m final by 0.004 of a second in dramatic photo finish

image.altText: A three year old girl in a pink shirt and cap sits next to her mum in a purple shirt and cap

props.synopsis: In Bringo, 370 kilometres north of Perth, Bridgitte Brooks is adding "fashion designer" to her CV, under occupational therapist, farmer and mother of four.

title.children: Athleisure wear designer says Aussie wool industry 'worth fighting for'

image.altText: Hard Quiz host Tom Gleeson smirks behind the podium. The Hard Quiz logo is in the top right corner

props.synopsis: Today might be the day you finally do OK at this quiz, but I'm not holding my breath.

title.children: You think you're good at quizzes? Let's test that theory
